block.p: American League BOSTON RED SOX--Acquired 3B Ed Sprague from the San Diego Padres for RHP Dennis Tankersley and INF Cesar Saba. DETROIT TIGERS--Agreed to terms with SS Exavier Logan and RHP Matthew Parris. KANSAS CITY ROYALS--Announced the resignation of Terry Wetzel, senior director of scouting.

American League BOSTON RED SOX--Acquired 3B Ed Sprague from the San Diego Padres for RHP Dennis Tankersley and INF Cesar Saba. DETROIT TIGERS--Agreed to terms with SS Exavier Logan and RHP Matthew Parris. KANSAS CITY ROYALS--Announced the resignation of Terry Wetzel, senior director of scouting.

National League METS--Signed RHP Robert Keppel and assigned him to Kingsport of the Appalachian League and LHP Jesus Martinez and assigned him to Binghamton of the Eastern League. Agreed to terms with OF Jeffrey Duncan, C Jose Castenada and 3B Justin Wendt. Placed RHP Rick Reed on the 15-day disabled list. Recalled RHP Jim Mann from Norfolk of the International League. ATLANTA BRAVES--Acitvated SS Rafael Furcal from the 15-day disabled list. Optioned INF Mark DeRosa to Richmond of the International League. COLORADO ROCKIES--Announced the resignation of Clark Weaver, senior vice president/corporate counsel.
National Basketball Association PORTLAND TRAIL BLAZERS--Announced F Brian Grant has declined his contract option, becoming a free agent.

National Football League ATLANTA FALCONS--Signed RB Ron Rivers. Waived QB Wally Richardson. DALLAS COWBOYS--Signed DB Stephen Fisher and OL Michael Leis. GREEN BAY PACKERS--Agreed to terms with QB Danny Wuerffel. MINNESOTA VIKINGS--Signed DB Tyrone Carter and C Mike Malano to three-year contracts. NEW ORLEANS SAINTS--Signed RB Michael Blair and K Shayne Graham to one-year contracts. Agreed to terms with QB Pat Barnes on a one-year contract. TENNESSEE TITANS--Promoted assistant director of media relations Robbie Bohren to director of media relations.

National Hockey League BOSTON BRUINS--Named Peter Laviolette assistant coach. FLORIDA PANTHERS--Offered qualifying contracts to C Rob Niedermayer, LW Ray Whitney, LW Peter Worrell, C Eric Boguniecki, D Dan Boyle, LW Dave Duerden, D Joey Tetarenko and D Rocky Thompson. Announced they did not offer qualifying contracts to C Andrew Long, LW Alex Hicks and D Jeff Ware. Declined to exercise their options on LW Chad Cabana, RW Paul Brousseau, RW Craig Reichert, RW Ray Sheppard and G Mikhail Shtaleknov. Released C Craig Ferguson. PHOENIX COYOTES--Re-signed D Chris Joseph to a one-year contract. Declined to exercise their options on G Bob Essensa, RW David Oliver, D Sean Gagnon and D Trent Cull. ST. LOUIS BLUES--Signed D Mike Van Ryn to a three-year contract.
Major League Soccer D.C. UNITED--Waived MF Mike Slivinski.

BALL STATE--Named Scot Bunnell, Angres Thorpe and Tracy Webster men's assistant basketball coaches. BUCKNELL--Named John Zeigler men's and women's water polo coach. BUTLER--Named Vickie Henson women's assistant basketball coach. Fired Ian Martin, men's soccer coach. IOWA STATE--Announced the resignation of Amy Pyle, women's gymnastics coach. KANSAS STATE--Announced it will not renew the scholarship of sophomore G Kenyatta Dix from the men's basketball team for an undisclosed violation of team policy. KUTZTOWN--Named Robert Fisher wrestling coach. NORTH CAROLINA--Announced the retirement of Bill Guthridge, men's basketball coach. OREGON--Named Shannon Rouillard women's golf coach. TULSA--Named Al Daniel and Kerry Keating men's assistant basketball coaches. VALPARAISO--Named Jay Spoonhour men's assistant basketball coach. WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA--Named Michael Craft men's assistant basketball coach.
